channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Not too hard, not too soft, rotting fruit is just right - for fruit fly maggots
item.description: It turns out, a maggot's preference for rotting fruit has as much to do with texture as taste. Researchers are looking into figuring out why and what neurons are responsible.
item.content:encoded:
It turns out, a maggot's preference for rotting fruit has as much to do with texture as taste. Researchers are looking into figuring out why and what neurons are responsible.

(Image credit: Helmut Hess/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: An earnest defense of America's silliest holiday: Groundhog Day
item.description: Let's celebrate Groundhog Day, in all its bizarre, quirky strangeness. Let it remind us that we have not subdued nature, but merely made ourselves more comfortable in its domain.
item.content:encoded:
Let's celebrate Groundhog Day, in all its bizarre, quirky strangeness. Let it remind us that we have not subdued nature, but merely made ourselves more comfortable in its domain.

(Image credit: Brett Carlsen)
item.dc:creator: Avery Keatley

item.title: Former German President Horst Köhler dies at 81
item.description: Köhler, a onetime head of the International Monetary Fund who became a popular German president before resigning abruptly in a flap over comments about the country's military, has died at 81.
item.content:encoded:
Köhler, a onetime head of the International Monetary Fund who became a popular German president before resigning abruptly in a flap over comments about the country's military, has died at 81.

(Image credit: Martial Trezzini)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Can Trump's 2nd act work for the working class while giving back to his super donors?
item.description: Trump has shown an affinity with many of the little guys — what he called in 2017 "the forgotten men and women." But he also has shown an affinity with some of the fattest cats of all.
item.content:encoded:
Trump has shown an affinity with many of the little guys — what he called in 2017 "the forgotten men and women." But he also has shown an affinity with some of the fattest cats of all.

(Image credit: Shawn Thew)
item.dc:creator: Ron Elving

item.title: 'The Sims,' gaming's ultimate social sandbox, turns 25
item.description: The original launched in February 2000 and spawned one of the most successful franchises in video game history. NPR's Susan Stone went hands-on with The Sims shortly after its debut.
item.content:encoded:
The original launched in February 2000 and spawned one of the most successful franchises in video game history. NPR's Susan Stone went hands-on with The Sims shortly after its debut.

(Image credit: Ryan Anson)
item.dc:creator: Susan Stone

item.title: Dear Life Kit: My husband is more emotional with his work wife than he is with me
item.description: An NPR listener wonders whether her husband's relationship with a female colleague is too close for comfort. He says she's being competitive for no reason, and that he sees the woman as a 'sister.'
item.content:encoded:
An NPR listener wonders whether her husband's relationship with a female colleague is too close for comfort. He says she's being competitive for no reason, and that he sees the woman as a 'sister.'

(Image credit: Eoneren/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Andee Tagle

item.title: A U.S. dual citizen is among 3 Israeli hostages exchanged for Palestinian prisoners
item.description: Siegel is the first American to be released as part of this deal. A total of 18 hostages have been released since the ceasefire took effect. Hundreds of Palestinians have been released so far.
item.content:encoded:
Siegel is the first American to be released as part of this deal. A total of 18 hostages have been released since the ceasefire took effect. Hundreds of Palestinians have been released so far.

(Image credit: AFP)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: A 2nd U.S. judge says Trump administration must pause its federal spending freeze
item.description: The decision came in response to a petition by attorneys general in 22 states and Washington, D.C., seeking to block the administration's efforts to freeze payments for grants and other programs.
item.content:encoded:
The decision came in response to a petition by attorneys general in 22 states and Washington, D.C., seeking to block the administration's efforts to freeze payments for grants and other programs.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: NPR Washington Desk

item.title: Plane with 6 aboard crashes in Philadelphia, setting homes ablaze
item.description: A medical transport jet with a child patient, her mother and four others aboard crashed into a Philadelphia neighborhood shortly after takeoff, exploding in a fireball that engulfed several homes.
item.content:encoded:
A medical transport jet with a child patient, her mother and four others aboard crashed into a Philadelphia neighborhood shortly after takeoff, exploding in a fireball that engulfed several homes.

(Image credit: Matt Rourke)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Map: A look at helicopter traffic patterns over D.C.
item.description: The airspace above Reagan National Airport, where a commercial plane collided with an Army helicopter this week, has become increasingly congested with air traffic, including helicopters.
item.content:encoded: The airspace above Reagan National Airport, where a commercial plane collided with an Army helicopter this week, has become increasingly congested with air traffic, including helicopters.
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman
